what can you say about spirit warriors  
Is that a trick question? ;)  
no trick ğŸ™‚  
If they are useful in the meta (If the best decks use these cards), if they have been reprint or not, and their rarity (there is 2 secret rare cards per display = 24 booster packs )  
what does reprint mean (like fake?)  
That's an extension of ygo (= Yu-Gi-Oh) from 2017. Usually a new extension has about 200 cards, most of them are new  
Reprint means new impression of a card in a set, like you can get it either by opening one pack or an other ( from 2 different extension)

What is the difference between my termonal and second window?  
The second window is a python shell  
It means that it's an environment where the interpreter expects code in python  
Where the other one is just your regular shell  
itâ€™s like terminal?

i search on the internet but i kinda have a problem that i donâ€™t know what im searching for  
It happens a lot ğŸ˜‡  
Formulating your problem is like a very good step toward the solution  
Usually, If you can formulate it, it's quiet easy to find a solution  
It's like 1/4 of my job  
1. What is a module and why do i need to connect it? Why do i need to connect it in terminal and now just run the code ?  
So a module is a library  
It's a bit of code programmed by an other developer, that can be added to the base code  
You need to connect it in the python console (terminal), because it's your development environment  
And once it's added in it, it's there  
So then you can simply run your code, with the module included

Well, you have a lot of specialties in France : general doctor (that's a specialty ^^' ) , surgeon (you get specialised for a specific area of the body), psychiatrist, cancer, ...  
I don't understand  
you said Clara is a generalist  
So here it how it goes, since you want the full explanation :  
You have a first year of medical uni : at the end of it, you get an order : the best, and the worst...  
there is a "numerus closus", which is the number of "needed" doctors : like, on 2000, it's 300, something like that  
and then there is like 50 dentists places, 50 midwife, and 50 osteopaths  
then, for doctors :  
Youn get 5 more years of general studies, with a lot of time in the 5 and 6th year in the hospital; the goal is to learn about body, diseases, and to work in different fiels, to know what you like, what you don't, and what you're good at  
At the end for the 6th year ( first year, called PACES, + 5 years), you have a national order  
(competitive exam)  
And the 1 chooses his specialty, among a lot : surgeon (you need to choose like heart, hand, face, ...)  
psychiatrist, sport doctor, general doctor (like the regular one), ....  
Honey thank you , but I was just asking what Clara does as a generalist?  
You choose a specialty, and where to learn/work  
And then you have 4-6 more years; but you're already working, and called "doctor"

That's a weird question ^^'  
So, in yugioh, there are different "sets"  
Like a new set is released every 2 months or so  
Soul Fusion is the last one (but a new one arrives in like 2 weeks)  
In each set, there is a set of cards you can have from the packs you buy; around 250 cards per pack (most of them are new ones)  
And everyone mixes them?  
So usually I buy a box of packs when there are cards I'm interested in the set; I did it for 'soul fusion', but I actually didn't really enjoyed the cards, so I selled/traded my cards to other players  
Yes, you can mix all the sets in yugioh  
Even though usually new sets have more powerful cards  
Okay ğŸ˜Š

In the French Consulate in Kiev, citizens of Ukraine and citizens permanently residing in Ukraine can apply for visas. The algorithm used for visa issuance looks like this:

First of all, the applicant must decide on the choice of the type of visa;
further - to collect the required documents;
call the Visa Office to determine the date of appearance at the consulate;
appear on the appointed day with the necessary documents.

Misha is not a student ? No, he is.

==> imparfait  
"J'ai habitÃ© Ã  Lyon pendant 22 ans (mais maintenant j'habite Ã  Paris)"  
Something in the past, lasting (emphasis on the time span), with a link to the present / the current conversation  
I lived in Lyon last year  
So this can be translated as I have lived in Lyon for 22 years  
so Itâ€™s visa verca  
I've lived in Lyon for 22 years  
It's exactly the same as in English  
I thought itâ€™s the other way around ğŸ™‚
